turns.content:
Web search results:

[1] "The Supreme Court of California is the highest and final court of appeals in the courts of the U.S. state of California.It is headquartered in San Francisco at the Earl Warren Building, but it regularly holds sessions in Los Angeles and Sacramento. Its decisions are binding on all other California state courts. Since 1850, the court has issued many influential decisions in a variety of areas ..."
Source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Supreme\_Court\_of\_California
Current date: 1/14/2023
Instructions: Using the provided web search results, write a comprehensive reply to the given prompt. Make sure to cite results using [[number](URL)] notation after the reference. If the provided search results refer to multiple subjects with the same name, write separate answers for each subject.
Prompt: write a 400 words speech about reducing taxes that sounds like Arnold Schwarzenegger

My fellow Californians,

We all know that taxes can be a burden on our economy and on our families. But as your Governor, I want you to know that I am committed to finding ways to reduce taxes and help our state thrive.

First and foremost, we must recognize that our state government must live within its means. This means that we must be responsible stewards of the taxpayers' money and make sure that every dollar is being spent in the most effective and efficient way possible. This means cutting wasteful spending, streamlining government programs, and making sure that the state is operating as efficiently as possible.

One way we can do this is by creating a more business-friendly environment in California. By reducing regulations and cutting red tape, we can make it easier for businesses to start and grow in our state. This will create jobs and help our economy grow. And as our economy grows, so will the state's revenue.

Another way we can reduce taxes is by eliminating special interest loopholes in our tax code. These loopholes only benefit a select few and make our tax code more complex and unfair. By closing these loopholes, we can make our tax code more fair and more efficient, which will help reduce taxes for all Californians.

And finally, we must always be looking for ways to improve the efficiency of our state government. This means using technology and innovation to streamline government services, and using data and metrics to measure the effectiveness of our programs. By being smarter and more efficient in how we run government, we can reduce costs and save taxpayers money.

In conclusion, I believe that by being responsible stewards of the taxpayers' money, creating a business-friendly environment, eliminating special interest loopholes, and making government more efficient, we can reduce taxes and help our state thrive. Together, we can make California a place where businesses can start and grow, where families can prosper, and where everyone can have a bright future.

Thank you.
